sen.j: 勘定所に属して勘定奉行の支配を受けて勘定所所属の諸役人を指揮・監督を行い、幕府財政及び農政を担当した。
sen.e: The kanjo-kumigashira is a member of kanjo-sho, the office of financial affairs, in charge of supervising and managing bureaucrats belonging to office under the command of its commissioner, the kanjo-bugyo, for administration of the cognate's financial policy and agricultural policy.

sen.j: 設置時期は寛文4年（1664年）とするのが通説であるが、それよりも30年以上も前の寛永年間には既にこの名称が登場しているため、設置上限はこの時期まで遡ることが可能とされている。
sen.e: The post is generally believed to have been created in 1664. However, the post name had already appeared more than 30 years ago during the Kanei period and the date of establishment may be revised to this date.

sen.j: 寛文12年（1672年）の職制によれば定員12名・役料は100俵であり、御殿（江戸城）担当が2名が設置され、残りは上方担当と関東地方担当に振り分けられていた（最低4名）。
sen.e: According to the job rank system in 1672, there were 12 appointed to this post, earning executive allowance of 100 bales of rice. Two of the kanjo-kumigashira were appointed to take charge of Edo Castle, and the rest appointed to cover the Osaka region and the Kanto region (at least 4 appointees).

sen.j: 天和 (日本)2年（1782年）に一旦役料が廃止されたが、享保7年（1722年）に改めて役高350俵が与えられた。
sen.e: The executive allowance was abolished once in 1682 but was restored in 1722 with rank-based salary of 350 bales. The region-based job function was abolished in the structural reform implemented in the following year (1723) and replaced by category-based appointments, namely, Goten-zume for Edo Castle, kattekata, torika-aratame, ukagaikata and shomuki-kanjocho-aratame.

sen.e: Appointments as kanjo-kumigashira remained thereafter until the end of the shogunate regime, with the number of appointees ranging between 10 and 13.
